summary: This is an email chain from October 2020 between legal team members coordinating the privilege review of electronic devices seized from Jeffrey Epstein. The emails discuss discrepancies in FBI inventory numbers (NYC numbers) for devices, confirm which data has been loaded into the Relativity review platform, and reference the upcoming discovery deadline for the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

events.title: FBI Production to SDNY
events.description: The FBI produced data from seized devices to the Southern District of New York (SDNY).

events.title: Devices Uploaded to Relativity
events.description: Extractions from seized devices were reportedly uploaded to the Relativity platform and marked as ready for privilege review.

events.title: Maxwell Case Discovery Deadline
events.description: The discovery deadline for the Ghislaine Maxwell case, mentioned as a driver for completing the privilege review.

keyFacts: The document is an internal email chain among legal personnel discussing the technical logistics of reviewing data from devices seized from Jeffrey Epstein.
It reveals an inventory tracking issue, with discrepancies between an FBI spreadsheet and a list of device data loaded into the Relativity review platform.
The correspondence indicates a rushed timeline, with a priority to complete privilege review to meet a November 9, 2020 discovery deadline for the Ghislaine Maxwell case.
Multiple FBI evidence inventory numbers (prefixed 'NYC') are listed, indicating a large volume of seized electronic devices.
The data was walled off for a privilege review, a standard legal procedure to filter out attorney-client communications before discovery.
